lines.text: "Come and see." And I looked, and behold a pale horse. And his name that sat on him was Death.
[the Preacher rides up on his pale horse]
And Hell followed with him.

When I left, those tin pans had all but given up. Their spirit was nearly broken. A man without spirit is whipped. But a preacher, he could give them faith. Shit! One ounce of faith, they'll be dug in deeper than tick on a hound. You boys, you go throw a rope around that man. You bring him to me!... No, don't. If we get too rough, we'll make a martyr out of him. Don't wanna give 'em a martyr'.
There's plain few problems can't be solved with a little sweat and hard work.
Nothing like a nice piece of hickory.
[last lines]

[her voice echoing through the mountains]
Preacher? Preacher? We all love you Preacher... I love you!... Thank you! Good-bye!
Well, if you're waitin' for a woman to make up her mind, you may have a long wait.
Meantime, why don't you put me to work?
Oh no, I couldn't ask you to, uh... Well, I mean, ya know - maybe if there was somethin' spiritual.
Well, that Spirit ain't worth spit without a little exercise. Now you tell me where.
[Preacher has just hit Club in the groin with a sledgehammer - Josh LaHood looks at Club when he gets back up on his horse and they start to ride away]
You think you can make it?
Ice!... Ice!
It was him. Him and his men. They shot him. Forever. The bullets kept hitting him. Forever.
Who are you? Who are you... really?
Well, it really doesn't matter, does it?
Sacramento ain't worth moose piss.
Do you imbibe?
Only after nine in the morning.
Where are you going Mr Hull?
I'm going into town
Ain't that kinda dumb after what happened last time?
Preacher my ass.

[Looks at Hull after Club and Josh leave but the rock is split]
... The Lord certainly does work in mysterious ways.

[Hull talking to his folks at night over the fire]
Starting fresh always sounds good when you're in trouble...
[first lines]
Lindsey.
